messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What kind of non-player characters does the Keeper give to the players?
pick-up non-player characters
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens in one of the scenes played out by the players?
one of the pick-up non-player characters is possessed by some supernatural force and murders his companions
You are a helpful assistant.
How do the players react to the scene?
they love the scene as it is quick and gruesome
You are a helpful assistant.
What allows the players to relax during the scene?
their investigators are not under threat
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to the non-player characters in one of the scenes?
They are possessed by a supernatural force and murder their companions.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why can the players relax during the action scenes?
Their investigators are not under threat, so they are not at risk of their main character dying.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to the councilor during the dinner scene?
He becomes quiet and his face changes as he takes hold of the carving knife.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the effect of the dichotomy between the players' knowledge and their investigators' knowledge?
It increases the tension.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the significance of the Keeper dropping hints during the dinner scene?
The Keeper drops hints to the players that this is the very house in which the earlier murder scene took place.
You are a helpful assistant.
How does the Keeper's mention of the councilor's behavior create tension?
The Keeper mentions how quiet the councilor has become and how his face changes as he takes hold of the carving knife...
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of investigators not knowing about the murder scene?
This dichotomy increases the tension.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the effect of the investigators sharing their discoveries?
The investigators fill each other in on what they have discovered.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the primary purpose of dealing with knowledge gained when playing non-player characters?
Building tension and boosting horror
You are a helpful assistant.
How can a player's investigator backstory drive the story forward?
By providing plot inspiration
You are a helpful assistant.
What is likely to happen to the players when their investigator backstory is woven into the game scenario?
They will be more involved
You are a helpful assistant.
What inspired Harvey Walters' love of archaeology?
Uncle Theodore
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the primary role of Harvey's backstory in the scenario?
The majority are more likely to form the basis for subplots.
You are a helpful assistant.
What artifact does the Keeper decide could be related to the mi-go?
A Mist Projector
You are a helpful assistant.
What does the publisher mention to the other author about Harvey's idea?
That Harvey's tale is more fact than fiction
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the other author's reaction to Harvey's story?
Suspicious, potentially in league with the mi-go or a potential ally
You are a helpful assistant.
Who might be in league with the mi-go?
Another author
You are a helpful assistant.
How does the tailor's information help Harvey?
Persuading the tailor to disclose information about his other clients.
You are a helpful assistant.
What might give a man back something broken?
Hurt him in such a way that he loses everything.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the condition of the other author?
Handsome, well-dressed, and a little overweight.
You are a helpful assistant.
Who suspects Harvey's tale is more fact than fiction?
Another author who mentions it in passing
You are a helpful assistant.
How might a man who has lost everything be hurt?
By being given back something broken
You are a helpful assistant.
What might be corrupted in a scenario as a result of madness?
Backstory entries
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the context in which to consider corrupting backstory entries?
Between sessions, when preparing a scenario
